snippet: Pedro Hernandez said he killed Etan Patz, 6, who vanished in 1979; the confession was recorded, but not the earlier questioning.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column holds that case against Pedro Hernandez in the murder of Etan Patz, who disappeared in 1979, is vexing, with a confession that no serious investigation can dismiss out of hand, but no corroborating evidence, or plausible motive.
lead_paragraph: Pedro Hernandez said he killed Etan Patz, 6, who vanished in 1979; the confession was recorded, but not the earlier questioning.

headline.print_headline: Confession Only Adds To Mystery In Patz Case
headline.seo: Police Tactics Add to Mystery in Etan Patz Case
headline.main: Confession Only Adds to Mystery in Patz Case
